Course.Title: ADV SEMI: ACT RES ESL/EFL T&L
Course.Description: This capstone course requires students to apply theoretical understandings of research and the knowledge/skills gained through their emergence as practitioner researchers in educational settings to conduct an action research project related to the teaching and learning of languages.

Sections.CourseDescription: This capstone course requires students to apply theoretical understandings of research and the knowledge/skills gained through their emergence as practitioner researchers in educational settings to conduct an action research project related to the teaching and learning of languages.

Course.Title: CUL, COG, COMM, FOR ELLS
Course.Description: Examination of cultural, cognitive, and communicative processes that impact learning within second language learning contexts.  Implications of TESOL and WIDA based instructional strategies are addressed. Emphasis is placed on ELL students and differentiated instruction.

Sections.CourseDescription: Examination of cultural, cognitive, and communicative processes that impact learning within second language learning contexts.  Implications of TESOL and WIDA based instructional strategies are addressed. Emphasis is placed on ELL students and differentiated instruction.
MeetingsDisplay: Tuesday 6:45 PM - 9:30 PM WKU General Education Hall C203 (Lecture)
Sections.FullTitleDisplay: TESL*5404*W01 CUL, COG, COMM, FOR ELLS
Sections.Title: CUL, COG, COMM, FOR ELLS

Course.Title: ACAD ENG L2 LRNRS W\INST TECH
Course.Description: An overview of L2 learners transition from basic English proficiency to success in the use of Academic English across the major content areas, e.g., LA, Math, Science, Social Studies, & Instructional Technology. Application of TESOL and/or WIDA standards will be examined.

Sections.CourseDescription: An overview of L2 learners transition from basic English proficiency to success in the use of Academic English across the major content areas, e.g., LA, Math, Science, Social Studies, & Instructional Technology. Application of TESOL and/or WIDA standards will be examined.

Sections.Title: ACAD ENG L2 LRNRS W\INST TECH

Course.Title: ASSES. OF LANG. PERF. ESL/EFL
Course.Description: This course focuses on the role of assessment in planning and instruction, setting realistic expectations for student performance, and meaningful assessment of ESL/EFL language performance in context.

Sections.CourseDescription: This course focuses on the role of assessment in planning and instruction, setting realistic expectations for student performance, and meaningful assessment of ESL/EFL language performance in context.
